result.execSummary:
Daniel Clark was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Daniel Clark was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel Clark

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: to Governor w/certified copy of signed waiver of extradition

Defendant Daniel Clark in court, in custody. David R Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  This is an extradition Hearing for a Cook County IL.  Defendant is waiving his right to extradition.  Court questions Defendant as to his rights.  Defendant reads waiver.  ADA Knaapen informs that the Defendant would have the right to contest if the proper person as well.  Defendant signs and dates the Waiver of Extradition, in Court. Court signs an original and 5 copies in Court.
